channel.title: Rsps = Legal?
channel.description:
Dear moparscapers,
Maybe my title could've been better, but yeah.. Okay so my question is to what point is making an rsps legal? Like can you make your rsps and just put it online with it being legal? Or is every rsps that's online illegal? For all the time I've been coding I really wondered if it was legal. Another question is, How about the RS 2006 sites. These are being recreated. Are these legal to use for any server or are they illegal. These questions may look stupid but I really don't know the answer to it. Hope someone can help me with this, halflive9

item.title: Rsps = Legal?

@F_A_I_L_S wrote:

this thread is ridiculous, but yet, funny.

No

Read full topic

item.title: Rsps = Legal?
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:17, topic:461707”][quote author=Taharahora link=topic=564655.msg4110086#msg4110086 date=1348433696]

My entire server is MINE the client is not; as long as you’re not hosting the client or cache in a country that RuneScape can buttfuck you in, your rsps is completely legal.

if i were you i’d read the copyright laws as well.
[/quote]

i know what i’m talking about.

here read this: http://www.moparisthebest.com/lawstuff

[quote]
You have to be joking, programs that I or others write on our own (for example SCAR) are 100% our code and they can be used for a multitude of purposes, just because some people use these programs to click on your game does not give you any right to have them removed and you know it, please don’t send any more of these nonsensical, unfounded requests regarding programs written by others you have no claim to.[/quote][/quote]

So Jagex didn’t reply back after the last response?

Read full topic

item.title: Rsps = Legal?
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:52, topic:461707”]http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copyright_law_of_the_United_Kingdom#Other_works

Jagex is from the UK meaning that it expires 70 years after creation.[/quote]
I was just going off what I was told a while ago on the copyright part but whatever. Servers are still up for the same reason people are still able to pirate games, there’s way to many to do any effective control on all of them.

Read full topic

item.title: Rsps = Legal?
item.dc:creator: @Togasa Togasa
item.description:
@Togasa wrote:

Taharahora:

The biggest servers are soulsplit and near reality each of them dont even have anything close to skills being right. Most reasons servers stay up is because of how shitty they are. but once things start getting more advanced things get shut down; which has happened in the past.

You’re an idiot. Jagex doesn’t have the time or patience to pursue legal action against every single private server. They usually only do this when a private server make’s alot of money, which to them is stealing their revenue.

All client shit are owned by Jagex…the models, sprites, etc, etc, etc…btw I thought you said you were done arguing? Stop commenting on this thread then.

Read full topic

item.title: Rsps = Legal?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“JavaTC, post:51, topic:461707”][quote author=Taharahora link=topic=564655.msg4110056#msg4110056 date=1348432703]

No, it wasn’t, just the StreamLoader class, and maybe a few methods were taken from the client, which is one of the two things we are using from Jagex.

But in the end it don’t matter rather it was grabbed or not from them it is still theirs and protected under the copyright law, it will be until either the company goes down under or until the copyright law isnt protecting the name ‘runescape’ anymore. from what i know they are constantly updating their copyright so even using a server from ten years old (which ten years is default to which a copyright law is no longer effective.) it will still be illegal and therefore if they decided to act “they” by law will win any lawsuit and are able to take any money made from the start of the private server or website.

The only way to get around it is to ask them for permission. which 1. most likely they will say no. or 2. they will make you buy copyrights
[/quote]
No.

The server files themselves were written by the authors and are completely legal as none of it is Jagex’s work, it’s the servers author’s.

The client it’self can be considered illegal, however if one re-writes it then you should be just fine as, from my knowledge, Jagex has released ownership of the outdated 317 cache anyway.

I also don’t see why they would feel the need to attack your server unless it was bringing in loads of profit like NR.

EDIT: I like how you argue as if your word is law on this subject, fucking seriously, man up and accept that you were wrong rather than getting butthurt about it and ending all ‘intelligent’ posts. I’m beginning to wonder who the kid is around here.[/quote]

en.wikipedia.org

Copyright law of the United Kingdom

Under the law of United Kingdom, a copyright is an intangible property right subsisting in certain qualifying subject-matter. Copyright law is governed by the Copyright, Designs and Patents Act 1988 (the 1988 Act), as amended from time to time. As a result of increasing legal integration and harmonisation throughout the European Union a complete picture of the law can only be acquired through recourse to EU jurisprudence, although this is likely to change in the near future when the UK leaves the...

Jagex is from the UK meaning that it expires 70 years after creation.

Read full topic

item.title: Rsps = Legal?
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“Taharahora, post:8, topic:461707”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=564655.msg4110047#msg4110047 date=1348432298]
No, it wasn’t, just the StreamLoader class, and maybe a few methods were taken from the client, which is one of the two things we are using from Jagex.
[/quote]

But in the end it don’t matter rather it was grabbed or not from them it is still theirs and protected under the copyright law, it will be until either the company goes down under or until the copyright law isnt protecting the name ‘runescape’ anymore. from what i know they are constantly updating their copyright so even using a server from ten years old (which ten years is default to which a copyright law is no longer effective.) it will still be illegal and therefore if they decided to act “they” by law will win any lawsuit and are able to take any money made from the start of the private server or website.

The only way to get around it is to ask them for permission. which 1. most likely they will say no. or 2. they will make you buy copyrights[/quote]
No.

The server files themselves were written by the authors and are completely legal as none of it is Jagex’s work, it’s the servers author’s.

The client it’self can be considered illegal, however if one re-writes it then you should be just fine as, from my knowledge, Jagex has released ownership of the outdated 317 cache anyway.

I also don’t see why they would feel the need to attack your server unless it was bringing in loads of profit like NR.

EDIT: I like how you argue as if your word is law on this subject, fucking seriously, man up and accept that you were wrong rather than getting butthurt about it and ending all ‘intelligent’ posts. I’m beginning to wonder who the kid is around here.

Read full topic

item.title: Rsps = Legal?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile

@Ambokile wrote:

Write a server
Write a chatroom client that sends the right login protocol (but does nothing with them)
If Jagex intervene, pass it off as a chatroom server

Read full topic

item.title: Rsps = Legal?
item.dc:creator: @Mikau Mikau
item.description:
@Mikau wrote:

Jagex:

You must not reverse-engineer, decompile or modify any Jagex Product client software in any way (except to the extent allowed by applicable law). You must not use a modified/customised version of the client software or attempt to sub-license it. You must not create or provide any other means by which any Jagex Product may be played by others (including, without limitation, replacement or modified client/server software, server emulators). Please note that any such activity may constitute civil wrongs and/or criminal offences, and Jagex reserves the right to take such action as appropriate in the circumstances should it become aware that such offences are being committed.

Read full topic

item.title: Rsps = Legal?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Derpington:

Imo, you are in trouble once you played RS or are still playing it. Cause then you agree to their ToS. Thing is, how do they know you accepted their ToS? You can just say, I never played the game myself, and thus I am not agreeing to your ToS. See my point? Other than that, we are copying shit from them, so yeah, it isnt that legit. But honestly, Jagex has better things to do.

Derpington:

[size=13pt]But honestly, Jagex has better things to do.[/size]

Derpington:

[size=15pt]Jagex has better things to do.[/size]

No they don’t, lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Rsps = Legal?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

The protocol between the server and client are intellectual property same as the client and cache, both the Stream and Cyrption classes from older WinterLove based servers that haven’t been retrofitted with a new legal version are considered illegal since that code is also intellectual property of Jagex.

Servers like Hyperion, Apollo, RuneSource, (one of sinisouls many), RS377, RS2dv, RS2HD, or any other frameowork created with out the use of either the Stream or Cryption class are legal with the exception of the protocol witch isn’t really something Jagex has gone after people about.

Read full topic

item.title: Rsps = Legal?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Taharahora:

The biggest servers are soulsplit and near reality each of them dont even have anything close to skills being right. Most reasons servers stay up is because of how shitty they are. but once things start getting more advanced things get shut down; which has happened in the past.

No. If a server gets to big, Jagex takes it down for using their client and cache, which they can’t do because the copyright is far expired for the 317 revision. Their ideas aren’t copyrighted either. So idk what you’re talking about…

Read full topic

item.title: Rsps = Legal?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:37, topic:461707”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=564655.msg4110187#msg4110187 date=1348438494]
If I host a server on a vps, Jagex cannot interfere as I own the actual server. If I host the cache on a webserver, they can interfere as they own the cache. Have you noticed how servers with webclients get taken down whilst those without rarely do?
[/quote]

or those with caches hosted in other off-shore countries.[/quote]

Yes, those too. The cache is Jagex’s property, not the server.

Read full topic
